channel.title: Beard problem

item.title: Beard problem
item.dc:creator: @King_Lingerz King Lingerz
item.description:
@King_Lingerz wrote:

use 317 deob.

Still does it.

zyle1992:

My advice would be to either change the client, and see if that helps, or look in the source for whatever reads the extra bytes that it shouldn’t be reading.

Changing the client had no effect, though you may be onto something there. Explain a little more?

Read full topic

item.title: Beard problem
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Respected Cheerio:

you need to add your item to your client.

No items were added to the client… Even if there were, it wouldn’t have that effect.

It seems like an attempt at getting headicons working. What I mean by that is Bluurrs client only works with Bluurrs Server, just Like back in the day, Project 16 would only work with the Xeroscape if the code hadn’t been commented out. It’s probably sending another pack, or byte, or word, or some other set of bytes. My advice would be to either change the client, and see if that helps, or look in the source for whatever reads the extra bytes that it shouldn’t be reading.

Read full topic

item.title: Beard problem
item.dc:creator: @King_Lingerz King Lingerz
item.description:
@King_Lingerz wrote:

Hey. I recently added beards onto my server, but they’ve gone slightly wrong. I’ve been searching for/trying to make a fix all night but nothing.

 	    if (!Item.isFullMask(playerEquipment[playerHat]) && !Item.isFullHelm(playerEquipment[playerHat])&& (playerLook[0] != 1)) {
    			playerProps.writeWord(0x100 + pBeard);
	    } else {
		playerProps.writeByte(0);
	    }

That changes your name to ‘Vyflkegpy2zz’ and makes your character do a strange emote. Your client crashes if you try walking.

BUT, it does add beards :p. How can I stop the ‘Vyflkegpy2zz’ and animation thing?

Read full topic
